title: Monkey Island Play! (Awsome so far)
content:
Ok recently at worldofmi.com they've been covering a high school production of a play based on the first monkey island game and now they are finally putting up the play to watch though its in parts and a new part would be available each week. Its really good so far and any fan of the games should check it out.
[url=http://www.worldofmi.com]www.worldofmi.com[/url]
be sure to download the subtitled versions since they are better.
Enjoy.The end is near. An evil force returns. And only Commander Keen can stop him, but this time he must team up with a super sonic hedgehog and a two tailed fox. Follow the adventure:[url=http://www.geocities.com/superadammario/chaos.html]Dimension Chaos[/url]
A Commander Keen and Sonic The Hedgehog Crossover Fan Fiction

Visit my website at [url=http://www.geocities.com/superadammario]www.geocities.com/superadammario[/url]

title: Re: Monkey Island Play! (Awsome so far)
content: I don't want to watch it but seems to be a nice idea. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] There aren't probably many plays made of games.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Monkey Island Play! (Awsome so far)
content:
perhaps a Keen play? That could be fun. I have been thinking of writing a script for a play based on a game and bringing it to the drama teacher who always puts on a play each year. Eh but maybe I could try it but I doubt it could happen since I'm busy with dimension chaos (I will finish it dammit even if it takes years!). Still its a thought that could work.The end is near. title: Re: Monkey Island Play! (Awsome so far)
content:
Keen play would be nice. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Let's see.. There's nicely human-like characters:
Keen
Mort
Lindsey
Gnosticine Ancients
Council Page
And of course there needs to be someone playing the dopefish. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Monkey Island Play! (Awsome so far)
content:
Hmmm I like it so far. Even though the acting is pretty bad I think the script is really good(it's excusable for middle schoolers). Although I think they could of done a better job with the Scumm Bar. It keeps true to the game a lot. Definitely one of the better games to base a play off of.


But this "Keen play" you speak of intrigues me... The only problem I see is the apparent lack of stuff happening besides pogoing, shooting and... eating candy(Same problem I have). You would have to take lots of liberties in making it. No matter how you look at it none of the characters have that much depth. Take for example Princess Lindsey. She is a princess of... what? The Gnosticine race? I dunno.-----------------------
"The Adventures of Commander Keen" issue #1: coming soon.

title: hehe
content: I find it amusing that Monkey Island actually had a place called the "Scumm Bar."  SCUMM is the abbreviated name for the engine that all those old point-and-click games run on.  SCUMM stands for Script Creation Utility for Maniac Mansion.  There's a Wikipedia thing on it [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SCUMM]here[/url].  Usually I'm not real big on the Wiki stuff, but that was the first real useful link I google'ed.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: hehe
content:
The bar got renamed Lua in the latest game:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lua_programming_language]en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lua...g_language[/url]

Sort of funny, although in general everytime I think about it, I think it's a shame the series went this way after the first 2 parts.
Such is life!

Wikipedia is cool though!
What's not to like?Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: hehe
content:
Heh. Nice piece of info there.

What's so bad about Wikipedia? I find it very useful as a source of information for school projects - much more so than Encyclopedia Britannica.
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.

title: well
content:
The main problem I have with it is that since it is basically public domain, people can alter it and contribute false information. Sure, there's hundreds of thousands of proof-readers to catch the mistake and fix it, but odds are there's some internet myths which have become widely accepted as fact due to their presence on Wikipedia. *shrug*

The site has grown a TON since I first had my issues with it, though, so I may be completely off base.

title: Re: well
content:
It's generally accurate for all but the most controversial topics - as you can imagine, there are thousands of people just waiting to put their own opinionated beliefs into Wikipedia articles and convince the masses that their viewpoint is correct. Otherwise, it's generally all good.
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.
Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: well
content:
One thing you've got to keep in mind is that a print encyclopedia isn't infallible either, and won't get updated as quickly. Another is that controversial topics are the ones most likely to be vandalized to support a particular view, and that solid facts (conductivity of aluminum?) are likely to be correct. You can never trust any one source on a controvarsial topic, so I don't see the Wikipedia as being at a disadvantage. Also, the hordes of compulsive recent updates list readers help keep it very accurate, for the most part. I've found it to be a reliable reference and a good starting point for a lot of research.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: well
content:
The way I see it, sooner or later math geniuses will find out about (the math articles on) the site and correct whatever's wrong in the relevant articles, the biologically inclined will do the same for those articles, etc..
I've read a bunch of scientific articles that went right over my head.
I realise that doesn't mean they are right, but it does mean people with some knowledge wrote them... right?
Like just mentioned, always bring your salt shaker, and use multiple resources when gathering information.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.
